channel.title: Need some server help!
channel.description:
Ok well i got my own server and for some reason i cant make myself admin or get my max skills?
Another question i have is how to make set up a shop custamized by myself?
Last quesiton is any advice can u give to a newcomer?

item.title: Need some server help!
item.dc:creator: @Snark Snark
item.description:
@Snark wrote:

You can add a spawn by using your autospawn.cfg

An example of spawning Jad would be:

spawn = 2745	3104	3933	0	0	0	0	0	1	Jad

The 2745 is the NPC ID - In this case Jad…
The 3104 and 3933 are the X and Y coords
The 5 zeros are X and Y ranges (Used for movement, keep them at 0 if you want a stationary NPC)
The 1 is WalkType (I leave this at 1)
Jad is the description of the spawn (You can type anything here, just used to remind yourself of what spawn it is)

Edit: No you do not need to change your source

Read full topic

item.title: Need some server help!
item.dc:creator: @Hero_The_God Hero The God
item.description:
@Hero_The_God wrote:

Ok now i need a big help, i just like totally forgot how to update something… OMG >_<

Ok if i need like a JAD in the middle of varrock i type in X and Y corr but what do i do after that
or
like if i want a monster to drop a certain item?

is there a guide to this?[br][size=1]Posted on: March 07, 2007, 08:04:33 PM[/size][hr]thanks for all ur help, change my source?[br][size=1]Posted on: March 07, 2007, 08:05:38 PM[/size][hr]u think i should change source?

Read full topic

item.title: Need some server help!
item.dc:creator: @Snark Snark
item.description:
@Snark wrote:

That explains it, Testscape wont let you edit the characters I guess for changing priveleges, let me find the code in client.java and Ill tell you what you need to do. (It’ll take a minute)

Edit:

Search for if (playerName.equalsIgnoreCase(“admin”)) in your client.java

You should see

if (playerName.equalsIgnoreCase("admin"))
				{
					playerRights = 3; 
				}

Change “admin” to your characters name.

If you want to add anymore admins, youll notice under

if (playerName.equalsIgnoreCase("admin"))
				{
					playerRights = 3; 
				}

There is more, Just change the names and the playerRights to the Name / Rights you want.

Compile and save.

Read full topic

item.title: Need some server help!
item.dc:creator: @Fr33b1e Fr33b1e
item.description:
@Fr33b1e wrote:

To make yourself admin, go into your character file, and find your name, open it, and change your rights to +1 (mod), +2 (admin), +3 (owner).

Read full topic
